thread.title: Tottenham legend Robbie Keane jokes he’d ‘walk to China’ for the kind of money they’re offering stars
thread.title_full: Tottenham legend Robbie Keane jokes he’d ‘walk to China’ for the kind of money they’re offering stars

author: dfraser
title: Tottenham legend Robbie Keane jokes he’d ‘walk to China’ for the kind of money they’re offering stars

organizations.name: news group newspapers ltd robbie keane

text:
Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments ROBBIE KEANE has said he is open to joining the Chinese Super League, joking: I’d walk there for that kind of money! 
The former Tottenham , Leeds, Wolves and Inter Milan forward is currently a free agent after leaving MLS side LA Galaxy at the end of 2016. Getty Images 5 Robbie Keane has joked he’d walk to China for the money they’re offering 
But Keane has claimed he is still looking to continue his goal-laden career, eyeing up a move to England, after we reported he could be on his way to Championship outfit Preston . 
Keep up to date with ALL the football news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary. 
Speaking on talkSPORT , Keane said: “I’m keeping well, training hard at the moment. So watch this space and see what happens.” 
When asked about China , he joked: “If they gave the money Diego Costa was offered, I’d walk there now!” LA Galaxy stars Steven Gerrard and Robbie Keane take on 25 ten-year-old fans - and win! EMPICS Sport 5 Robbie Keane enjoyed two superb spells at Premier League side Tottenham 
On being quizzed as to whether anyone from the Chinese Super League had been in touch he added: "No, not at the moment." 
However, Keane did go on to say he had been receiving offers from a host of clubs regarding a potential move. 
The Tottenham legend claimed: "I've got a few offers from England and abroad. Robbie Keane belts out tune with pals in packed Dublin pub News Group Newspapers Ltd Robbie Keane has also discussed a return to former clubs Wolves and Leeds PA:Press Association Robbie Keane has also been linked to a move to Championship side Preston 
"I had to knock back a couple... Maybe a little too far away. 
"As I said, I've got a few offers on the table at the moment, I've had a lot of people asking me to come back to Leeds, Wolves and so on. 
"Great clubs obviously I've played for, but you can't go somewhere you've not been offered. 
"There's been a few offers from the Championship and a few other sniffs here and there, but I can't really comment too much. Sportsfile 5 Robbie Keane enjoyed some time with the Irish Amputee Team over Christmas 
"Definitely haven't heard anything from Leeds or Wolves, but a few other Championship teams which I don't really want to mention too much, as it wouldn't be fair on them." 
Keane went on to say he would love a Premier League return, saying he's a proven goalscorer and is still hungry to make the grade at the top of the game. 
The Irish international said: "I think I'd be fine [in the top flight], I keep myself fit. 
"I still have the hunger, the desire. I've always scored goals wherever I've gone. I think I can help a team, help the younger players."
